parent

protected CParsingContext parent
The parent parsing context, corresponding to the parent scope.

reentrant

protected boolean reentrant
Whether the scope this parsing context is associated with is reentrant. This is used to parse function definitions.

Method Detail

fork

public Actions.Context fork()
Description copied from interface: Actions.Context
Fork this context. This method is invoked on regular fork operations but not on fork operations due to context.

Specified by:
fork in interface Actions.Context
Returns:
The forked context.

shouldFork

public boolean shouldFork(ForkMergeParser.Lookahead n)

reclassify

public Collection<ForkMergeParser.Lookahead> reclassify(Collection<ForkMergeParser.Lookahead> set)
Description copied from interface: Actions.Context
Given the follow-set, reclassify tokens in the set and return any new tokens that result from implicit conditionals, e.g. the typedef/var name ambiguity in C. Do not add tokens the follow-set.

Specified by:
reclassify in interface Actions.Context
Parameters:
set - The follow set.
Returns:
Any new tokens or null if there are none.

isType

public CParsingContext.trit isType(String ident,
                                   xtc.lang.cpp.ContextManager.Context context)
This method determines whether an identifier is a typedef name, var name, or both by inspecting the symbol table in this scope and any parent scopes.

Parameters:
ident - The identifier.
context - The presence condition.

mayMerge

public boolean mayMerge(Actions.Context other)
Description copied from interface: Actions.Context
Determine whether this context can merge with another. This method is invoked on merge candidates that already observe the merge discipline (modulo context).

Specified by:
mayMerge in interface Actions.Context
Parameters:
other - The other context.
Returns:
true if the contexts may merge.
